channel.title: Best Songs To Listen To High
channel.description:
I want to start making a list, if anyone wants to add to it do so. ;) (They're in no specific order just whatever comes first)
1. Kottonmouth Kings - 420 2. Kottonmouth Kings - Where I'm Going 3. Kottonmouth Kings - Wheres the weed at 4. Kottonmouth Kings - Bong Toke 5. Kottonmouth Kings - Tangerine Sky 6. Kottonmouth Kings - Kottonmouth Song 7. Kottonmouth Kings - Pack Your Bowls 8. Kottonmouth Kings - Proud To Be A Stoner 9. Kottonmouth Kings - Rest Of My Life 10. Afroman - Because I Got High 11. Afroman - Back To School 12. Afroman - Colt 45 13. Subnoize Souljaz - I Got 5 On It 14. Tech n9ne - Get Blowed 15. Tech n9ne - T9X 16. Potluck - What We Are 17. Potluck - Say What Ya Wanna Say 18. Potluck - Hotbox Anthem 19. Potluck - Smoke The Pain Away 20. Potluck - Stoner Bitch 21. Potluck - Marijuana 101 22. Cypress Hill - Hits From The Bong 23. Cypress Hill - Dr. Greenthumb 24. Cypress Hill - I Wanna Get High 25. Sublime - Smoke 2 Joints 26. Twiztid - Bagz 27. Twiztid - Hydro 28. Lil Boosie - Smokin On Purple
Add Onto the list, put the number such as ;D
29. Artist - Songname

item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“Kane., post:10, topic:331035”]I’m Blue. Just lovvvvve it when I’m high.
Crystal Castles is amazing, but even better on acid.[/quote]
Absolutely, Crystal Castles is amazing regardless of your state of mind.

item.source: Best Songs To Listen To High

item.title: Best Songs To Listen To High
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Kottonmouth kings are horrible. I used to like them, but that was before I knew anything about rap. They have 14 albums that do nothing but talk about how hardcore it is to smoke weed.

I just listen to the same music as when I’m sober. It makes no difference to me. But if your blazing in a car then gangster rap is the way to go surely.

Read full topic
item.source: Best Songs To Listen To High

item.title: Best Songs To Listen To High
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:3, topic:331035”]I always listen to this:
Part 1: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m-QQVdHRdxA
Part 2: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ot8NKRqQg_w
Especially in the second part, if you really concentrate, you can just feel all the different instruments blending together. The shitty quality of the youtube one doesn’t help, find the flac if you really want to enjoy it.[/quote]Good choice. Complex (or very very slow) music is best when ur high.

Read full topic
item.source: Best Songs To Listen To High

item.title: Best Songs To Listen To High
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

I always listen to this:
Part 1: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m-QQVdHRdxA
Part 2: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ot8NKRqQg_w
Especially in the second part, if you really concentrate, you can just feel all the different instruments blending together. The shitty quality of the youtube one doesn’t help, find the flac if you really want to enjoy it.

Read full topic
